alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Penobscot County through 730 PM EDT... At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Orneville, or 11 miles north of Old Town, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grand Falls, Milford, Enfield, Hudson, Greenbush, Bradford, Alton, Lagrange, Passadumkeag, Burlington, Lowell, Argyle and Greenfield. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 203 and 213. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
